The city is located near the

border along the Trans-Mongolian Railway and has a population of around 21,000. The city was founded in 1940 and named after the founder of the People's Republic of Mongolia and hero of the Mongolian Revolution of 1921, D. Sükhbaatar. There is also a province in
named after him. The Orkhan and Selenge Rivers merge just west of the city.
With the first (or last) stop on the Trans-Mongolian Railway of the
in Mongolia, as well as the main paved road between the capital,

, and the Russian border, Sühbaatar is very easy to reach. There is one bus a day that leaves from the Dragon Center in UB everyday at 16:30 that stops in Sühbaatar on its way to the Russian border in Altanbulag, a few miles away. Another option is to take one of the buses that leave hourly from UB to
. From there, micro-buses and taxis leave throughout the day for Sühbaatar.
There are 2 trains a day from the capital to Sühbaatar, a day train that leaves at 10:30, with a stop at

at 08:52, and arrives at 20:00 and a night train that leaves at 21:10, with a stop at Darkhan at 03:25, and arrives at 05:30 the next day. The train returns to UB at 06:35 and arrives at 16:20, and at 21:05, arriving the next day in UB 06:10.
